author: deluckybrick
title: Personally, I only like this set because of the spinner.
review:
As I said before, this set is good only because of the spinner.  I would not have bought this set, but it came in my Brickmaster subscription, so I built it just in case.  The only other pro besides the spinner is the blade-like weapon bit.

5/10, at the most.

author: lordofdragonss
title: Baby Rakshi?
review:
I love his design. and I love how  rakshi head is used.He looks like a baby Rakshi ^^

Pluses:

Design
Rothuka Spnner
Another Rakshi head :D

Minuses:

Old parts?
Not much posable.

I higly recomend get this set when you love Rakshi or smal Bionicle critters.

4.7\5

author: hedgehog_lover
title: The not quite grown up rakshi
review:
Well then, to start off I shall mention the fact that the Rotuca Spinner is a good playability function even though it can get in the way and the cord makes the set look ugly when it's in. I would personally have liked the rahaga to go with the rakshi like the bohrok va went with the bohrok but oh well. I also found out that all the rahaga must lean on their staff to stand up. Now to the pros and cons.
PROS-
Looks like a mini rakshi
Nice little staff
rotuca spinner
CONS-
Looks ugly with rotuca cord in
Blue colour could be better
Buy if-errm,you like the rahaga
don't buy if-you like big sets.

author: Pepper
title: pretty good
review:
I bought this set from my sister recently. Pros. and cons.

Pros.
spinner
weapon
head
pieces

Cons.
not much playability

Overall, good for people who like to play with Bionicles.

author: Gus_263
title: Like other Rahaga
review: I Think that Gaaki is just like all other Rahaga. With some cool pieces, The Gaaki's Color is not the best that the blue can be, but i really like to use it. The Spinner is another option to have fun with the rahaga, and the Guurahk's Staff is a great piece to use. I Just think that the rahaga don't have much differences, i rate Gaaki 4/5

author: asianlego
title: No studs included.
review: I was never a fan of Bionicle because they don't use any studded bricks but I love mechas and this one seems to fit in nicely with its color scheme. The twin-tipped spear looks awesome and the rotuca spinner is great! Although spinning the thing is a habit once its in your hands, try not to do it in a room full of objects as it may be easy to lose if you've forgotten your glasses..

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Great Companion to Nokama
review:
I know a lot of you guys out there think Gaaki stinks, but I think that '05 wouldn't have been complete without the Rahaga.  Gaaki's tool is the double-pronged one from Guurahk.  Her spinner, like all of them, go way high, even though they're rather inaccurate.  Her face is a darker blue version of Guurahk's.  The eyes are kinda too far back in the head, but you can see them as they are bright orange.

Pros:

-Goes with Nokama good

-Reused Guurahk staff

-Spinner

-Orange eyes

-Articulating arms and legs

Cons:

-Eyes are positioned a little too far back in the head

So if you have Nokama, get Gaaki.  If you have Gaaki, get Nokama!!  Happy building!! :D

author: 1_for_Legos
title: Okay.
review:
This was my first bionicle, i got it from Brick master 05. I really like the staff and the disk spinner.

Pros.

rakshi mask

spinner 

staff thing

Cons.

legs and arms are hardly posable

needs staff to stand.

An o.k. set.

author: Kalhiki
title: Wow, that staff looks big in the pic.
review:
First off, not very poseable (I still don't know if that's correct spelling). Basically it's a miniturized Guurahk. The head can surn from side-to side. The leg movement depends on how you connect the waist. Forward-can't move back. Down- The legs will have to be sticking out. The arms have a bit more range, but if bothe hands are on the staff, it can't move that much. She also has the Rhotuka launch on her back which is probably the best launcher (incredible heighth and distance).
Overall, good. The lack of poseability in the limbs marks this figure (and the other Rahaga) down. Just a note: I'm not doing the other Rahaga unless I have time. I find it pointless to do 6 reviews of figures that are basically the same. Really, If your going to get one it'll either be for storyline reasons or color.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Rahaga) - Rahaga Gaaki Review
review:
This is a good little figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has two pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 28 pieces which is the same amount of pieces we've used to have in the other Rahaga figures. This figure was 4 USD and had a price per piece ratio of 14 cents per piece when it was on sale which may be a little bit high but it's still worth the money.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/4868-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On the back of this figure is a spinner which you can launch very easily. The spinner flies very well, too. On one hand we can also see a nice looking staff. I really can't complain much about this figure - even if it doesn't do much.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Nmfrey23
title: The Rahaga are... not the best
review:
The Rahaga are meant to be the small sets from the year 2005. Their builds are nearly identical to one and other, and they aren't that good. Gaaki's only difference from the rest of the rahaga are the colours she uses, and her staff piece.

Pros: 

.Rahkshi head and Bohrok Feet in dark blue

.Rhotuka spinners

Cons:

.Bad stability

.Due to the pre-bent knees, the Rahaga are permanently bowlegged 

.Rhotuka spinners are hard to aim because of clunky build and bad movement

.Head only moves side-to-side and looks very hollow

.No new parts except spinners

Overall, this is a purely OK small set. 2/5
